meanings.definition: Capable of being exchanged for cash.
meanings.sent1: The gift card was encashable, so I could easily trade it for money.
meanings.sent2: She preferred encashable investments that could be quickly turned into cash.
meanings.sent3: The magician's hat seemed encashable, as it kept producing money out of thin air.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like an encashable currency, brightening everyone's day.
meanings.sent5: The idea of winning the lottery felt as encashable as finding a pot of gold at the end of a rainbow.

meanings.definition: Able to be converted into cash.
meanings.sent1: The check was encashable at any bank in town.
meanings.sent2: He always kept some encashable savings for emergencies.
meanings.sent3: The old coins in the jar looked encashable, ready to be turned into bills.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like encashable promises, always coming true.
meanings.sent5: The opportunity to sell his artwork felt as encashable as a winning lottery ticket.

meanings.sent1: The winning ticket was encashable at the lottery office.
meanings.sent2: The voucher was encashable only during the promotion period.
meanings.sent3: The lost wallet was found by someone encashable enough to return it.
meanings.sent4: His skills were encashable assets in the competitive job market.
meanings.sent5: The rare stamp collection was as encashable as a hidden treasure waiting to be discovered.
